intro: Hoodia ruschii, commonly known as the desert gourd, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and melons. The plant is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, yellow flowers. Its fruit is a smooth, elongated capsule that turns from green to yellow as it matures. Hoodia ruschii is adapted to arid environments and is often found growing in rocky soils.
